name: Crowne Plaza Orlando Downtown

reviews.text: I travel frequently and rarely do I take the time to write a review, but my stay at this hotel deserved my time to give them an excellent review.
reviews.title: Excellent choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the time I checked in, "NO WAIT", and the front desk person treated me like I was important, How rare is that, these days??
reviews.title: Nice room but undesirable area.
Disaster
reviews.text: The room was spotless,the towels were so soft. Also the food in the restaurant was very good, I actually ate there every night. I felt like I was at home.
.Everyone at the Hotel Staff always greeted me and ask how was my stay, or if I needed anything.
reviews.title: Items Missing After Housekeeping

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Even though I was in Orlando for business, I will make sure and come back to this hotel and refer any and all of my family and clients
reviews.title: Crowne Plaza Needs Work
Absolutely awesome!
reviews.text: The service, rooms, amenities and location were all great. But most important to me, was the service. I conducted a Region Meeting there, and did not anticipate some needs I would have. Every time I called, they were RIGHT ON IT - with a smile!!! I will absolutely be back should I ever have the need again.

reviews.title: Just What I Needed and More!
reviews.text: The hotel has an upscale feel to it and I felt right at home for the 10 days that I stayed.

reviews.title: A great experience!!!!
reviews.text: Service: I was happy to see Abigail at the front desk in the daytime and Mark (or Mike?), who was one of the managers. They were always cheerful and pleasant to deal with.

reviews.title: BEST HOTEL I'VE STAYED IN MANY TRAVELS TO ORLANDO
reviews.text: Valet/Parking: Although I was happy that I didn't have a car with me as there is a daily self-parking fee and valet service, I was extremely happy with the shuttle service that is offered for travel wthin a 3-mile radius. Leo and Tashaun, 2 of the drivers, had the BEST service and personalities!

reviews.title: Five Second Chances, But No More!
reviews.text: Room Service: The food is priced as you would expect for room service, but I definitely appreciated the quality (great chicken sandwich and waffle fries!!). I only went down to the actual restaurant 1x, but was still satisfied .

The rooms at this hotel are extremely comfortable, modern and plush. I was fortunately upgraded to a suite, which was huge: large kitchen and Living Room, huge bedroom, huge bathroom with both large tile shower and jacuzzi tub. The Crowne Plaza is not in the most interesting of neighborhoods- really nowhere to walk, but it's centrally located by car to all of Orlando. The price of the room and size made my stay very comfortable.
reviews.title: Very Comfy Hotel, Totally Renovated

reviews.text: My friends and I stayed overnight here when we went to a concert at the nearby Plaza Live Theatre. We got a special rate of $80 that's extended to concertgoers. Thought everything was clean and comfortable, with good amenities and courteous responsive service. Comfy bed and nicely appointed room with what seemed to be fairly new furniture, equipment, etc. I stayed at this same hotel back in 1994 when it was a Holiday Inn -- and back then it was pretty shabby. Nice job, Crowne Plaza!
reviews.title: Nice place, excellent value with good service

reviews.text: Not worth the 95 bucks a night we spent which is inexpensive so that should say something. I'm not a fan of crowne to begin with but this place was not nice...I went for a family wedding...they had odd hidden fees. Dirty rooms. Stopped up tub/shower ...disgusting ..the area looked run down as well...ghetto
reviews.title: Um no!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is conveniently located. I have read many comments about noise in the area, it is due to the traffic. It cannot be a problem, you're so close to everything. I care a lot about cleanliness, I only have Kudos for the whole personel. The smile on everyone's face makes me feel home. This Hotel meets my expectation.
reviews.title: I love it and I'll definitely be back.

reviews.text: We stayed there from the 6th thru the 10th of July. Terribly mediocre experience. The shuttle service and attitudes of the valets was so awful, the manager needed to comp our parking. Several times, the front desk agents seemed preoccupied or otherwise put off by guests.
reviews.title: Doesn't come close to Crowne Standards.
It is a Holiday Inn, really - with no pool
reviews.text: This used to be the Hoilday Inn - At the Arena. For all I know, it still is. They turned it into a Crowne Plaza without changing anything. Oh wait, of course they changed something: they closed the pool!

reviews.title: Solid experience for one night
reviews.text: To be more precise, there is a pool, but you are not allowed to use it. From reading the recent comments, you see they have been waiting for the "grand opening" for a long time. When I made my reservation over the phone, I therefore specifically asked them whether the pool was open. The answer, after a slight hesitation, was yes. The truth is no. At the time, they were probably hoping for it, but it is not going to happen anytime soon, according to onsite staff.

reviews.title: Not What I Expected for a Crowne Plaza
reviews.text: Something else that was inaccessible was my balcony. The doors were locked shut. For safety reasons, they said. No chance to convince them I was grown up and not going to fall over the railings.

reviews.title: Be forwarned of noise!
reviews.text: The receptionsts were courteous and corret, but snappy, not warm and welcoming. One could not help but get the impression they were only waiting for the guests to go away and leave them alone. What happened to hospitality?

reviews.title: Good stay in Orlando
reviews.text: Self-parking is $10 per night. Contrary to what the Downtown name suggests, the hotel is _not_ in what you would call a city center, and parking options are _not_ few and far between. Consider off-loading your baggage at the front door and parking in the street.

description: Experience the Crowne Plaza Orlando Downtown Hotel, the newest choice among downtown Orlando hotels. Located off I-4 in downtown Orlando, this address provides easy access to everything to see and do in Orlando. The urban, chic Crowne Plaza Orlando Downtown Hotel is walking distance to downtown s impressive entertainment venues such as Amway Center home of Orlando Magic, the Bob Carr Theatre for Performing Arts, 6 miles from Universal Studios, Sea World Orlando and 15 miles from Walt Disney World Theme Parks. The Crowne Plaza Orlando Downtown is 4 miles from Orlando Executive Airport (ORL), fabulous shopping, and a vast array of restaurants and nightclubs. We are only 13 miles from Orlando International Airport (MCO) and 10 miles to the Orange County Convention Center, Daytona 500 is only 48 miles away, and we are only blocks from the Citrus Bowl home of the Capital One Bowl, Champs Bowl, and the Florida Classic. Known as The Place to Meet, the Crowne Plaza Orlando Downtown Hotel is a premier venue for meetings and groups, and is located close to industry leaders such as Sun Trust, Wachovia, HD Supply, EA Sports, AMA, Orange County Courthouse, FAMU Law School, and Orlando Regional Medical Center. We are proud to be a Green Lodging hotel and our dedicated team of professionals looks forward to providing the ultimate in service. We are a 100% non-smoking hotel.
